Find the Village to <style="status">Heal</style> and <style="status">Recruit</style> a Follower.
Custom Map
Market & Interactions

Looking at the Map you should plan a route to the Location that you are interested in interacting with, for example the Village to recruit Followers. Each Location offers different options and some require you to Conquer them before you can Interact. You can hover with your mouse for a preview of what the location does, or click to see more details. Note: At any point during the game (including when interacting) you can press Esc to bring up the Pause Menu which shows all your Cards, Followers, Blessings and Market Offers. You can also press F1 to bring up the Codex which explains all game Keywords.
Move to the <style="value">Village</style>
Use the Map description command (d space m) to find and move to the Village
Interacting with Villagers

In order to Recruit or Buy stuff you need to move to a Location on the Map. Different locations provide different services. You can hover your mouse on the Locations to see what they do. In this case the Village will allow you to recruit Followers and heal the <style="wound">Wound</style> in your Hand.

You can also open the <style="value">Market</style> panel to see what special abilities you can get and where:

* <style="value">Followers</style> can be recruited at their preferred location,
* <style="value">Spells</style> are granted when you win Battles at Spires and can be purchased there afterwards,
* <style="value">Advanced Abilities</style> are granted on level-up (hover mouse on XP bar to see next Level Rewards) but can also be acquired at Temples.

An interaction only starts when you purchase or recruit stuff. After an interaction is started, the current turn will be ended after the interaction is concluded. In this case, the scenario will end when you click on 'End Turn'.
Use Cards, Followers and/or Blessings to Generate <style="value">{0}</style> Leadership points
Use the description command (d) to activate Cards, Followers and/or Blessings to Generate {0} Leadership points
Leadership Points

The currency for interacting with Locations is called <style="value">Leadership</style>. Leadership points are added to a pool at the top of the screen (below XP bar), similar to movement points.

Your <style="value">Reputation</style> (next to character picture) gives you a bonus / malus to Leadership. If your reputation drops too low, you won't be able to interact with Locations anymore.

You need to activate Cards, Followers and Blessings to gain Leadership points. When you spend leadership points by Recruiting or Purchasing stuff, your cards and Mana will be committed.
Use <style="value">3</style> Leadership to <style="status">Heal</style> your <style="wound">Wounds</style> at the Village
Use 3 Leadership to Heal your Wounds at the Village
Wounds

<style="wound">Wounds</style> are useless cards clogging your hand and <style="status">cannot be discarded</style>. You acquire Wounds during Battle or when activating some Abilities.

Your Followers can become <style="wound">Wounded</style> if they are assigned damage while in Battle. Wounded Followers <style="status">cannot be used anymore</style> until they are Healed.

You can Heal wounds at certain Locations (Source, Village, Temple) or by playing Healing Effects.

In this scenario, the Villagers can <style="status">Heal</style> your wounds. You could also play cards with the <style="status">Healing</style> effect to generate Healing points and heal yourself or Followers outside a Village or Temple. Healing points (like Movement or Leadership) are added to a pool below the XP bar and can be spent to heal Wounds.
Use <style="value">5</style> Leadership to <style="status">Recruit</style> a Follower at the Village
Use 5 Leadership to Recruit a Follower at the Village
Recruit Followers

Followers can be recruited at their preferred Location or at the Bazaar for additional cost.

Check the <style="value">Market</style> to see the list of Followers for hire and where to find them. This list is refreshed at the beginning of every Day / Night.

Remember that you have a limited number of slots to manage Followers (check panel for details). If you hire more than the number of slots available, you will need to discard the excess.

To recruit Followers, move to the Village, activate Abilities to generate enough Leadership points into the pool so that the Follower you want becomes affordable then pay for their cost. Note that doing so will automatically start the interaction locking you into the interaction screen until you end the turn / leave the Village.
